traceability.evidence:
1) CLI parsing: src/cli-options-helpers.js and src/cli-options.js implement `--severity`, with a validSeverities array ['none','low','moderate','high','critical'], defaulting to 'none'.
2) Config‐file support: src/config-loader.js reads `severity` and `prod.minSeverity`/`dev.minSeverity` from .dry-aged-deps.json.
3) Filtering logic: src/filter-by-security.js uses severityWeights and blocks any vulnerability with weight ≥ the configured threshold.
4) Override precedence: parseOptions applies CLI > config file > default policy, and test/cli.config-file.test.js verifies that flags override the config file.
5) Defaults & validation: invalid or missing `--severity` exits with code 2 (test/cli.flags.test.js), and when omitted the default threshold is 'none' (blocking all) per test.
6) Help text: bin/dry-aged-deps.js’s `--help` includes `--severity= Vulnerability severity threshold: none, low, moderate, high, critical (default: none)`.
7) Test coverage: test/filter-by-security-severity.test.js confirms correct behavior for below‐threshold, at/above‐threshold, and legacy numeric stubs.
traceability.notes: All acceptance criteria for story 006.0 (configurable security threshold) are fully satisfied and verified by concrete implementation and passing tests.
